intro: Pimela rigida, commonly known as the rigid pimela, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Pimela rigida is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
